content.question: Equal volumes of <math alttext="0.2 Molar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.2</mn><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> solutions of lead<math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>(II)</mtext></mrow></math> nitrate and potassium bromide are combined to form lead<math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>(II)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> bromide as a yellow precipitate. Which of the following is the correct net ionic equation for the reaction?

choices.label: <math alttext="P b with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus, 2 B r with a negative one charge, aqueous, react to produce, P b B r 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Br</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>PbBr</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="K with a positive one charge, aqueous, plus, N O 3 with a negative one charge, aqueous, react to produce, K N O 3, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>KNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P b with a positive 2 charge, aqueous, plus, 2 N O 3 with a negative one charge, aqueous, plus, 2 K with a positive one charge, aqueous, plus, 2 B r with a negative one charge, aqueous, react to produce, 2 K with a positive one charge, aqueous, plus, 2 N O 3 with a negative one charge, aqueous, plus, P b B r 2, solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>Br</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>2</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>PbBr</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="P b, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2, aqueous, plus, 2 K B r, aqueous, react to produce, P b B r 2, solid, plus, 2 K N O 3, aqueous" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Pb(NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>KBr</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>PbBr</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>KNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
